1.brief: properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors

2.brief: properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to revolve, surround, or border; used in various applications, literally and figuratively
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

3.brief: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
literally a failure of flesh, i.e. emaciation; figuratively, hypocrisy
a head person (of any rank or class)

4.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to commit adultery; figuratively, to apostatize
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling)

5.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
a head person (of any rank or class)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
{a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon}

7.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to

8.brief: Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to overflow (specifically with oil.); by implication, to mix; to fodder
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert

9.brief: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

10.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

11.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
a dove (apparently from the warmth of their mating)
to open, i.e. be (causatively, make) roomy; usually figuratively (in a mental or moral sense) to be (causatively, make) simple or (in a sinister way) delude
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

12.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
something heard, i.e. a sound, rumor, announcement; abstractly, audience
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel
to sever, i.e. ransom; gener. to release, preserve
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly
near, with or among; often in general, to
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

to howl (with a wailing tone) or yell (with a boisterous one)

a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
must or fresh grape-juice (as just squeezed out); by implication (rarely) fermented wine
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)

15.brief: to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
near, with or among; often in general, to

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

16.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, the top; specifically, the highest (i.e. God); also (adverb) aloft, to Jehovah
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a head person (of any rank or class)
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
